hints.content: Start by understanding how to convert an integer into its individual digits. You can do this by converting the integer to a string and then iterating over each character.
Remember that after converting the integer to a string, each character represents a digit. You will need to convert these characters back to integers before adding them to your final result array.
Consider how you will iterate through the array of integers. You can use a loop to go through each integer in the input array `nums`.
As you process each integer, think about how you will store the digits. You might want to initialize an empty list at the beginning to collect all the digits.

When you separate the digits from each integer, ensure that you maintain the order of digits as they appear in the original integer. This means you should append each digit to your result list in the order you extract them.
Consider edge cases, such as when the input array contains a single integer or when the integers have different numbers of digits. Your approach should handle these cases seamlessly.
Make sure to check the constraints of the problem. The input integers are guaranteed to be positive and can be as large as 100,000, which means you need to handle potentially large numbers.
After processing all integers in the input array, your final result should be a flat list of digits. Ensure that you return this list in the correct format as specified in the problem statement.
Think about the time complexity of your solution. You will be iterating through each integer and then through each digit of those integers, so consider how this affects performance.

To summarize, your approach should involve iterating over `nums`, converting each integer to its string representation, extracting the digits, converting them back to integers, and appending them to a result list. Start coding this step-by-step!

questionNotes: Return the digits in the same order as they appear in the input array.
